posts.content:
The Epic Scythe-lord 


Image source: https://img4.goodfon.com/wallpaper/nbig ... -sword.jpg


Fighter / Bard / RDD is a very classic and powerful build combination. 
This build draft aims to cover new ground exploring this combo.

Goals:
1. Bard heavy
2. Large large scythe criticals from very high strength
3. Enjoyable balance

It features:
- Base Str 42 (cappable to 54), Base AB 45 (BAB 26), WS/EWS, KD, Disarm/Improved Disarm
- 400hp, keen edge, haste, wounding whispers, improved invisibility/UMD/tumble 40 +4AC from RDD etc etc
- Bard Song/Curse Song/Taunt/Lasting Inspiration/Craft Wand/ESF: Perform
- 290 odd skill points (which get eaten up quickly), No exp penalties

Looked different to some of the other builds:

ECB Archives
- Taloned Wandering Minstrel by I....Samphus
- The Skillful Minstrel Bard by Cinnabar Din
- Sings with Hammer by Talamier
- Sings with Dragon (and Big Sword) by Ithacan

Tapatalk ECB Forum
- Greatsword Bard draft by Syphereal
- Demoralize and Disarm by EasternPromises
- Deekin Scalesinger by Maximillan Kane

None have base Str more than 38 as far as I can see.

Panthro, the strongest dever in the world by Valerfor has more Str (44) but is half-orc fighter heavy, and has no spellcasting.

Dev crit can be put into the build but then you don't get to see the big numbers.

Anyway appreciate your comments and thoughts, maybe you guys would do things differently, love to hear it. 

Image source: https://media.moddb.com/images/groups/1 ... ra1988.jpg

posts.author: Zanithar
posts.content:
A solid build, I like it as is. My only suggestion is that disarm/improved disarm are best if you take them together. I’d likely juggle your feat schedule a smidge and push out Disarm to somewhere close to improved disarm and perhaps pull in improved knockdown.

Also, I see it here in this build, but I tend to arrange my build to work on servers where you can “rebuild” I tend to take my first skills at level 2 where feasible AND spend my first level feats on something universal to all builds of a particular type ... like blind fight. Sometimes causing a little upfront pain but makes it easy to play with later should I need to.

I see that here, not sure if it was for similar reasons but I was quite pleased to see it regardless.

posts.author: grizzled_dwarflord
posts.content:
I'm not sure about the "all-in" on Strength from the get go.  Since there's no Dev Crit in the build, there's little incentive for a 42 Strength vs. 40 strength.  This could allow you to actually invest in Charisma and Constitution, and then drop Toughness feat for a metamagic spell like Extend Spell, Still Spell or Craft Wand.  Shoot, and then you could actually know 5th and 6th level spells too (you'd be able to Still War Cry, among others).

The only other suggestion I would make would be to find a way to get Lasting Inspiration before Level 39.  With 24 levels of Bard, it's hard to justify such a late placement when this could serve your build much better over the course of his career.  Many folks when they build, they build with Level 40 in mind.  When I build, I keep level 40 in mind, but I also keep in mind the build's career.... the journey not the destination.  But that's just me.

Thanks Zanithar, I can group disarm and improved disarm closer, great suggestion.

For this build, and for what I had in mind, the ultra high Str is what makes it special, it still retains a lot of playability. Finishing on an even modifier for a str two hander is also nice too. Its hard to take LI earlier without dropping Str or EWS. Yes a little min maxing but I think it will work fine here.

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content: I tend to agree with GDL about Lasting Inspiration. Ignoring Curse Song and Taunt, that's still +2 AB, +3 damage, and +5 AC pretty much all day every day for your whole party. In fact (and I know this won't sound much like me) I might even be tempted to stop at Fighter 4 and not bother with EWS at all - with 42 STR and a scythe you don't really need that extra damage bump. And LI is for Bards what ED is for Rogues, after all. It just seems a bit of a waste to wait so long for it.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Thanks Stag and GDL for pushing me to get LI sooner.
It can be done and I have taken it as a bonus feat at level 37 by removing the preceding fighter levels.
With the leveling split it can't be taken sooner than level 36, where I would need to drop 2 great strengths.
It could be fit in earlier but then RDD 9 and 10 would have to be delayed, and this did not seem worth it. 

I dropped EWS for ESF: Perform which is taken as a bard bonus feat.
With bard song active, curse song is level 21-22, and -11 to -12 to enemy skills (instead of -5 I believe). 
This makes them much easier to knockdown, disarm or taunt. 
I believe overall this makes the build much more powerful than the +4 damage, albeit ESF: Perform is taken at level 40. 

Due to this I dropped improved knockdown for craft wand. 
The main consequence being huge enemies will be no longer able to be knocked down.
This is probably less impactful given a lot of module creatures will make epic level bosses difficult or immune to knockdown. 
Craft wand solves a lot of problems including dispels and spellcasting during combat.

I also included Zanithar's suggestion to take both Disarm/Improved Disarm together, great spot. 

Will edit the main post shortly.
Thanks again for all your suggestions and tweaks, it has been great to read of your opinions on how you would play such a build, and it has enriched my knowledge.

posts.author: Aquarius 233
posts.content:
Love to see these huge criticals! :)

You could fit EWS in spite of a -1 AB and -1 damage (so net damage bonus from EWS would be 3) by going either:
 - bard9/RDD8/fighter3
 - rdd10/bard8/fighter2
These combinations should let you maximize bonus to saving throws (i.e. grant a boost on all saving throws).

Then, in epics, swap 2 great strenght feats with:
 - when leveling as a fighter: WS (general feat) + EWS (fighter bonus feat);
 - other level: epic prowess.

posts.author: Empyre65
posts.content: To fit my play style, I would make a lot of changes.  I would go Bard 16 / Fighter 14 / RDD 10, starting with STR 16, DEX 12, and CON 14.  I would have 4 more pre-epic levels of Fighter, giving me Improved Knockdown and (on a Bard level) Lingering Song, leaving 6 epic levels of Fighter, granting EWS, Epic Prowess, and Armor Skin.  All of this would net me +3 damage (-1 from lower STR and +4 from EWS), +4 AC (+2 from higher DEX and +2 from Armor Skin), +1 AB (-1 from lower STR , +1 from Epic Prowess, and +1 BAB from the 4 additional pre-epic Fighter levels), and +40 health from the higher CON.  Oh, and the saves would be +1 Fortitude and +2 Reflex, plus whatever changes result from the changing 4 pre-epic levels to Fighter.  I would have to decide whether to delay 4 levels of Bard or 4 levels of RDD to epic.  That would be a whole different build, though.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Actually getting all the bard stuff earlier is nice not just the lasting inspiration. The Lasting Inspiration is just icing on the cake if I'm honest, current build draft has 26 bard levels or 26 usages of Bard/Curse Song combined. Having a 100 round duration bard song is nice but I suspect curse song is going to be more useful, funnily enough, to destroy the opponent's stats and skills. One can then taunt them, improved disarm them, knock them down etc etc... Pity one can't use curse song with a self-silence aura, but at least one can self-dispel the self-silence that pretty easily.

I've playtested this one through solo Saltmarsh -> Three Heads (Borderkeep) -> Necromancer -> Hill Giants -> Dragon Cult I, its level 18 right now
The starting Str 18 is VERY nice, honestly I would not change that
The build is super strong, its like having dev crit except you get it at level 5-10 when you can boost the strength high enough to deal essentially lethal critical hits
A little bit of boosting of Con for HP (ie items, Endurance potions) helps with balancing stats early but once RDD 7 is obtained with +2 Con it makes a big difference.
Also having a shield and a one handed weapon in reserve, one loses 1 AB for more defense which is better against mobs, the two handed weapon being very strong in a 1v1 situation, if you have all your buffs up (with UMD, or other), or against mages who will hate you intensely as you approach them invisible with a x4 crit weapon, 30-40 str and a self-silence aura
Improved knockdown would be nice, if you dont like craft wand you could drop craft wand for improved knockdown. Having 20-50 casts of bull strength/prot v evil/haste/improved invisibility on a wand is very nice though...

Empyre's split would get a lot more combat feats, making space for potentially still spell and Cha 14(16), and devastating critical
The main downside of a Bard 16 / F 14 / RDD 10 split will be if you want to skill dump say Tumble 40, is that Bard (Curse) 16 Song comes pretty late at level 37+, it is the sweet spot of the bard power.
I did design that in mind, trying to get the Bard 16 song asap. The F4/RDD10 that comes preceeding does delay things a little but I believe that cannot be helped, one will want BAB 26 for 4 APR, then RDD 10 for maximal Str boosts/Fire immunity etc.
